availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: Newell B. Beauchamp (Nelson County, KY, farmer)

body.p: Nelson County, Kentucky, farmer. Kentucky native. Married to Eliza Murphy Beauchamp in Nelson County in April 1833. Father of Susan Beauchamp, Sarah Beauchamp, and Anne Beauchamp. Farmer in Nelson County in 1840. Owned three enslaved persons in Nelson County in 1840. Farmer in Nelson County in 1860. Owned fourteen enslaved persons in Nelson County in 1860.

ab.bibl:
Sixth Manuscript Census of the United States (1840), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Nelson County, p. 39.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Nelson County, District 1, p. 224.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Slave Schedules, Kentucky, Nelson County, p. 119A.
Ninth Manuscript Census of the United States (1870), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Nelson County, Chaplin Precinct No. 2, p. 110A.
Kentucky Marriage Records, Madison County Courthouse, Richmond, Kentucky, Nelson County Marriages, April 6, 1833, Film #001929414, p. 19.
Find A Grave, "Newell B. Beauchamp, Jr. (1807-1891)," Memorial 117313226, https://www.findagrave.com/memorial/117313226 (accessed April 15, 2020).
